private_information: I specialize in extracting formal action schemas and predicates from natural descriptions.
I ensure preconditions and effects are faithfully captured without inventing hidden resources or shortcuts.
domain_curator.goal: Produce a precise, structured outline of the domain (predicates and actions with parameters, preconditions, add and delete effects) based solely on the public information.

private_information: I specialize in grounding problem instances: objects, initial facts, and goals.
I consolidate multiple scenarios while preserving their distinctions.
state_modeler.goal: Compile the complete object set and the initial states and goals for Scenario A and Scenario B into a clean, machine-readable structure.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency.
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or hidden resources and ensure that only stated preconditions and effects are used.
I propose minimal plan repairs when necessary.
auditor.goal: Validate the Scenario A plan against the outlined domain and initial state, identify any violations, propose minimal repairs, and state invariants and remarks applicable to both scenarios.

private_information: I harmonize symbols and ensure all names are used consistently across domain and problem descriptions.
I do not alter semantics; I only reconcile naming and ordering.
naming_resolver.goal: Produce canonical lists of predicates, actions, and objects, including any symbol mappings or notes, to avoid ambiguity.

private_information: I integrate all upstream analyses and produce the final planning artifacts.
I target the FastDownward solver with clean STRIPS-style PDDL.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the curated domain, compiled states, audit report, and resolved symbols to produce a finalized PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (Scenario A and Scenario B) suitable for FastDownward.

public_information: Objects present in all descriptions: object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3, object_4, object_5, object_6, object_7, object_8, object_9, object_10.
Predicates used: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), next(x,y), vase(x,y), collect(x,y).
Action Paltry(o0,o1,o2). Preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2. Add effects: next o0 o2. Delete effects: vase o0 o1.
Action Sip(o0,o1,o2). Preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2. Add effects: vase o0 o1. Delete effects: next o0 o2.
Action Clip(o0,o1,o2). Preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2. Add effects: vase o0 o1. Delete effects: next o0 o2.
Action Wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3). Preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3. Add effects: next o0 o2. Delete effects: next o0 o1.
Action Memory(o0,o1,o2). Preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1. Add effects: next o0 o2. Delete effects: next o0 o1.
Action Tightfisted(o0,o1,o2). Preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1. Add effects: next o0 o2. Delete effects: vase o0 o1.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_8; next object_9 object_6; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
Scenario A goal: next object_9 object_7.

Scenario A proposed plan (to be audited): wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1 -> clip object_9 object_3 object_6 -> wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1 -> tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_5 -> sip object_9 object_0 object_5 -> memory object_0 object_5 object_7 -> paltry object_9 object_0 object_7.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; next object_0 object_8; next object_1 object_6; next object_10 object_9; next object_4 object_6; next object_5 object_9; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario B goal: next object_10 object_6.
Scenario B plan: not provided and must be found by the planner.

curation.system_prompt: You are a domain modeling expert. From the public information, extract a precise structured outline of the planning domain. Represent your result as JSON with keys: predicates (list of predicate names with arities), actions (each with name, parameters, preconditions, add_effects, del_effects). Do not output PDDL; do not invent hidden resources or shortcuts; remain faithful to the described actions and predicates.
curation.prompt: Use the environment public information to build the structured domain outline. Preserve exact symbol names as given. Provide clear parameter names like o0, o1, etc., matching the described positions. Public information: {environment->public_information}.

state_compilation.system_prompt: You are a state modeling expert. Extract the full object universe and compile the initial facts and goals for both scenarios. Output JSON with keys: objects (array of all object symbols), scenarios (object with A and B keys), where each scenario has init (array of ground facts as strings) and goal (array with a single ground fact as a string). Do not output PDDL.
state_compilation.prompt: From the public information, list all objects and assemble the Scenario A and Scenario B initial states and goals exactly as stated. Avoid assumptions beyond the provided facts. Public information: {environment->public_information}.

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal consistency auditor. Validate whether the Scenario A plan is executable from the given initial state under the curated domain. Identify any step that violates preconditions, and propose a minimal repaired sequence if issues exist. Also extract invariants and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or hidden counters if any appear in intermediate interpretations; rely only on stated predicates and action semantics. Output JSON with keys: valid_plan_A (boolean), failures (array with details), repaired_plan_A (array of actions or null), invariants (array), remarks (array). Do not output PDDL.
audit.prompt: Audit the Scenario A plan using the curated domain outline and compiled states. Report any violations with step indices and missing preconditions, and provide a minimally repaired plan if possible. Also state invariants you can infer. Curated domain outline: {curated_domain_outline}. Compiled states: {compiled_states}.

resolution.system_prompt: You are a symbol harmonizer. Ensure consistent naming of predicates, actions, parameters, and objects across the domain outline and scenarios. Produce canonical orderings and note any mapping decisions. Output JSON with keys: canonical_predicates, canonical_actions, canonical_objects, mapping_notes. Do not output PDDL.
resolution.prompt: Reconcile any symbol naming or ordering issues. Confirm the canonical lists and provide mapping notes only if needed. Domain outline: {curated_domain_outline}. Compiled states: {compiled_states}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. Integrate the inputs to produce one PDDL domain that exactly captures the six actions and their stated preconditions and add/delete effects, and two PDDL problem files: one for Scenario A and one for Scenario B. Ensure the output is compatible with FastDownward (classical STRIPS style). Use either untyped or a single type thing consistently; if you use types, include :typing and declare all objects of type thing. Include only necessary predicates and objects. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and each problem in <problem name='...'></problem> tags, using names problem_scenario_a and problem_scenario_b. Use the auditor's findings to ensure Scenario A is solvable without introducing hidden resources or changing action semantics.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the curated domain outline, compiled states, audit report, and resolved symbols to produce the final PDDL domain and two problem instances for Scenario A and Scenario B. Keep predicate and action names consistent and effects purely add/delete. Inputs follow. Domain outline: {curated_domain_outline}. Compiled states: {compiled_states}. Audit report: {audit_report}. Resolved symbols: {resolved_symbols}.
